channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: As ACA enrollment drops, hopes for Congress to restore funding are fading
item.description: ACA enrollment is down for the first time in 5 years, and people are facing enormous premium hikes. Hopes for Congress to restore funding are fading.
item.content:encoded: ACA enrollment is down for the first time in 5 years, and people are facing enormous premium hikes. Hopes for Congress to restore funding are fading.
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: Escalating tensions in Minnesota
item.description: Tensions continue to escalate in Minnesota as the state continues to be the center of the administration's immigration crackdown. NPR's Jasmine Garsd reports from Minneapolis.
item.content:encoded: Tensions continue to escalate in Minnesota as the state continues to be the center of the administration's immigration crackdown. NPR's Jasmine Garsd reports from Minneapolis.
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Garsd

item.title: A Saudi-UAE rift is turning two close allies into regional rivals
item.description: The key question now is whether the Saudi-UAE rift settles back into business as usual or accelerates into a wider realignment, says Marc Lynch, professor of political science and international affairs at George Washington University.
item.content:encoded: The key question now is whether the Saudi-UAE rift settles back into business as usual or accelerates into a wider realignment, says Marc Lynch, professor of political science and international affairs at George Washington University.
item.dc:creator: Ahmad Damen

item.title: 'You need to find joy together,' says leader of Beth Israel synagogue's religious school after arson attack
item.description: A week after an arson fire at Mississippi's oldest synagogue, Rachel Myers, a leader of the congregation's religious school, talks about how the congregation is doing and about this weekend's services.
item.content:encoded: A week after an arson fire at Mississippi's oldest synagogue, Rachel Myers, a leader of the congregation's religious school, talks about how the congregation is doing and about this weekend's services.
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: Senators travel to Denmark as Greenland tensions rise
item.description: A bipartisan group of Senators is in Denmark speaking to officials there as President Trump announces new tariffs and continues to talk about taking over Greenland.
item.content:encoded: A bipartisan group of Senators is in Denmark speaking to officials there as President Trump announces new tariffs and continues to talk about taking over Greenland.
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: How NPR's Stephen Fowler crunches the data on the Epstein story
item.description: Stephen Fowler is NPR's go to reporter for document dumps. He explains how he approaches the day's biggest stories...and its most perplexing datasets.
item.content:encoded: Stephen Fowler is NPR's go to reporter for document dumps. He explains how he approaches the day's biggest stories...and its most perplexing datasets.
item.dc:creator: Linah Mohammad

item.title: 'You need this knowledge,' says Henry Louis Gates Jr. as new season of Finding Your Roots premieres
item.description: Henry Louis Gates Jr. previews the complex, multi-generational stories shaping the newest season of PBS' Finding Your Roots.
item.content:encoded: Henry Louis Gates Jr. previews the complex, multi-generational stories shaping the newest season of PBS' Finding Your Roots.
item.dc:creator: Avery Keatley

item.title: Uganda's longtime leader declared winner in disputed vote
item.description: Museveni claims victory in Uganda's contested election as opposition leader Bobi Wine goes into hiding amid chaos, violence and accusations of fraud.
item.content:encoded:
Museveni claims victory in Uganda's contested election as opposition leader Bobi Wine goes into hiding amid chaos, violence and accusations of fraud.

(Image credit: Luis TATO)
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Akinwotu

item.title: Nurses with three New York health systems have been on strike this week
item.description: New York City's nurses strike could go on for weeks. Nurses are seeking better pay and protection from violence on the job, among other things. The hospital systems say the price is too high.
item.content:encoded: New York City's nurses strike could go on for weeks. Nurses are seeking better pay and protection from violence on the job, among other things. The hospital systems say the price is too high.
item.dc:creator: Caroline Lewis

item.title: ICE surge sparks fear and resistance in Minneapolis
item.description: Minneapolis residents are resisting as federal immigration agents surge into their city, creating what some locals describe as an atmosphere of fear and siege on the streets.
item.content:encoded: Minneapolis residents are resisting as federal immigration agents surge into their city, creating what some locals describe as an atmosphere of fear and siege on the streets.
item.dc:creator: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán
